TopicTitle: Map view bug after trying to switch vessels from tracking station

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.2.0 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Win latest version | CPU: 12th Gen Intel Core i9-12900K | GPU: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3070 Ti | RAM: 32GB

 

Hardware:

CPU: 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-12900K

RAM Size 31.79GB

Video Card: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3070 Ti

 

Severity: High (game breaking bug. I cant seem to fix the map view. It looks pretty cool, but i don't want to play the entire time like this)

Frequency: Low (first time i encountered this bug)

 

I honestly don't know what exactly happened. i think in order;

1) I was controlling a craft in Kerbin orbit.

2) went to the tracking station and selected another vessel to control that is in Duna's orbit.

3) Then after the camera focused on the craft in flight view, the camera started flying away or just stopped following it (hard to tell in orbit).

4) Opened the map, saw that the previous vessel was still being "controlled" (which tends to happen often to me, but can usually be fixed by going back to tracking station and clicking control on the vessel again). 

5) Closed the map, and the camera refocused back to the previous controlled craft

6) Then opened the map again to try to switch back to the craft i wanted to control and that I think is when the map went schizo.

 

None of my in-game attempts to fix the bug worked, liked reloading the save, switching to other crafts, going back to KSC, VAB, Tech Tree, etc., It persisted in the map view on every single craft.

fortunately closing and reloading the game got rid of the bug.
